intro: Melandrium auriculatum, commonly known as the yellow catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in fields, roadsides, and along woodland edges. Melandrium auriculatum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
